OCD.description: Configure Cross Origin Resource Sharing (CORS) for the CDR Endpoints
OCD.name: CDR Endpoint CORS Configuration

AD.name: Allowed Credentials
AD.description: The value for the Access-Control-Allow-Credentials header. If false, no header is added. If true, the header is added with the value 'true'. This is used to indicate to the client that cookies should be included in CORS requests. If this is checked, there must be at least one value in the 'Allow Origins' (meaning all sites can't be allowed)

AD.name: Allow Origins
AD.description: Leave empty to allow access from all sites. If you want to restrict the sites then specify the specific domains to allow (e.g. http://example.com)

AD.name: Expose Headers
AD.description: The list of custom headers you want to expose to the client. If no custom headers are needed by the client (or set by the CDR Endpoints) leave blank
